intro: Eumachia pallidinervia, commonly known as the pale-veined eumachia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with prominent, pale veins. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
